#summary The CSVStrategy is used to specify the format of the CSV file

= The CSVStrategy =

The CSVStrategy specifies the format of the csv file and the behaviour of the CSVReader. There are various parameters that can be configured:
  * `delimiter` _char_: the seperator of the tokens
  * `commentStart` _char_: the comment indicator char 
  * `skipHeader` _boolean_: if true, skips the first line

You can pass your own CSVStrategy when building the CSVParser:
{{{
new CSVParser.Builder<MyClass>.(csvReader).strategy(myStrategy)...;
}}}

= Defaults =

jCSV comes with some default implementations for the CSVStrategy:
  * `CSVStrategy.DEFAULT`: Uses ';' as delimiter, and '#' as comment indicator. It does not skip the head line.
  * `CSVStrategy_UK_DEFAULT`: Uses ',' as delimiter, and '#' as comment indicator. It does not skip the head line.

If you don't specifiy a CSVStrategy, `CSVStrategy.DEFAULT` will be used as default.
